page.title: 06ECOLOGY
page.content: {CRAIGELLACHIE NATIONAL NATURE RESERVE Dominating Aviemore is Craigellachie Rock which lies behind the Aviemore Centre on the far side of the new A9. A circular trail around the reserve passes Loch Pulladern and the old reservoir which can no longer meet the demands of the village.The trail supports two official view points which command superb views over Spey Valley.The trail was designed by the NCC in 1977 and was built by local men employed under the job creation scheme. {Flora and Fauna }This area is made up of heather,mosses and lichen on the high ground and wild birch woodland on the lower slopes.There are many different forms of wildlife living here,such as rabbits,red and roe deer,foxes,grouse,capercaillie and osprey.
